Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2016 03:35PM joanie84 wrote: My biopsy is on Monday. That chart is great. Thank you for posting it. That definitely helps to put it into perspective. I just hate sitting and waiting my mind goes to too many places. I'm not a very good "waiter".
Posts.Title: Pleomorphic calcifications Spanning 2.5 cm Area BiRad 4 joanie84 Sunnygurl

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2016 05:09PM joanie84 wrote: I had my biopsy on Monday and got the results today. They found abnormal tissue. I have an appointment to see my breast surgeon next Thursday. They want to remove the remaining tissue around the site. They said it is not cancer but it is high risk and needs to be removed.
Posts.Title: Pleomorphic calcifications Spanning 2.5 cm Area BiRad 4 joanie84 Sunnygurl

Posts.Content: joanie84 wrote: I had a bilateral digital diagnostic mammography last Thursday after my annual screening came back as incomplete. According to the report from the radiologist my right breast shows Pleomorphic calcifications spanning 2.5 cm Area and a BiRad 4. 4 years ago I had a core biopsy on my right breast that was benign. The current calcifications are not in the same area as the previous biopsy. My breast are also considered dense and are a DD. I am 43 years old, with three children. I breastfed them all to about a year old. My maternal grandmother had breast cancer in her 40's, my mother had breast cancer when she was 65 and my sister had DCIS at the age of 46. My sister had the BRCA test and it was negative. I have been reassured by the radiologist as well as my breast surgeon's PA that the odds are this is benign and worse case scenario it is very early stages. I just can't help but be a bit worried. Having two biopsies in the same breast in the span of 4 years when I am still in my early 40's just seems daunting. Dx 8/2016, ILC, Left, 1cm, Stage IA, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Surgery 9/9/2016 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Radiation Therapy 11/7/2016 Whole-breast: Breast Log in to post a reply
